Sentencas: The functional layer of a flat-tubular solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) is examined using a three-dimensional microscale electrode model.
Titulo: Effects of Microstructural Functional Layers on Flat-Tubular Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: SOFC electrodes essentially include two types of layers: a structural layer and a functional layer.
Titulo: Effects of Microstructural Functional Layers on Flat-Tubular Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The structural layers, which are the anode support layer and the cathode current collector layer, are composed of large particles with a high porosity that facilitates gas diffusion.
Titulo: Effects of Microstructural Functional Layers on Flat-Tubular Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The functional layers consist of small particles with a low porosity that increases the triple phase boundary (TPB) reaction area and reduces the activation overpotential.
Titulo: Effects of Microstructural Functional Layers on Flat-Tubular Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: In the model, the particle diameter and functional layer thickness are adjusted and analyzed.
Titulo: Effects of Microstructural Functional Layers on Flat-Tubular Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The effects of the two parameters on the performance of the functional layer are monitored in the contexts of several multilateral approaches.
Titulo: Effects of Microstructural Functional Layers on Flat-Tubular Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Most reactions occurred near the electrode-electrolyte interface; however, an electrode design that included additional TPB areas improved the electrode performance.
Titulo: Effects of Microstructural Functional Layers on Flat-Tubular Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The role of the functional layer in a flat-tubular SOFC is examined as a function of the functional layer particle size and thickness.
Titulo: Effects of Microstructural Functional Layers on Flat-Tubular Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The performance of a cell could be enhanced by preparing a functional layer using particles of optimal size and thickness, and by operating the device under conditions optimized for these parameters.
Titulo: Effects of Microstructural Functional Layers on Flat-Tubular Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
